Get ready to delve into the captivating world of Greg Kinnear Movies! In this roundup, weâ€™ll take a journey through the memorable and enchanting films that have starred the talented and versatile Greg Kinnear. From heartwarming dramas to riveting thrillers, weâ€™ll explore the range of Kinnearâ€™s films, shedding light on the unforgettable characters and thrilling storylines heâ€™s brought to life on the big screen. So buckle up and get ready for an exciting cinematic experience!

1. What Price Victory (1988)

What Price Victory, â€œ released in 1988, is a heart-wrenching drama that explores the trials and tribulations faced by two college football players. One player, driven by a passion for the sport, is forced to juggle demanding athletic expectations with his lackluster interest in academics.

2. Murder in Mississippi (1990)

In 1964, Southern America witnessed a horrific and deadly confrontation between the extremist Ku Klux Klan and three Civil Rights activists who strived for equality in their fight for African-American voter registration. Murder in Mississippi masterfully takes the viewer through the last three weeks in the lives of those tragically slain, unveiling the heart-wrenching consequences of hate and the power of perseverance in the face of adversity.

3. Dillinger (1991)

Dillinger (1991) takes the audience on a thrilling journey through the actual events of the infamous pursuit of American bank robber John Dillinger during the 1930s. This captivating film is based on the real-life character of John Dillinger and showcases the relentless pursuit of the notorious criminal by FBI agent Melvin Purvis. Under Rupert Wainwrightâ€™s direction and written by Paul F. Edwards, the movie stars Mark Harmon as John Dillinger and Sherilyn Fenn as Billie Frechette.

5. Blankman (1994)

Blankmanâ€ (1994) is a hilarious blend of action, comedy, and crime-fighting fun. Damon Wayans stars as Walter Blankman, a simple-minded inventor, and the protagonist of this high-energy movie. After stumbling upon a low-budget and bulletproof costume, Walter becomes Blankman, a superhero dedicated to combatting crime in the city. With the help of his loyal and resourceful brother (played by David Alan Grier), Blankman works tirelessly to protect the community. While this vigilante may not have the polish of other superheroes, his heart and determination make him an unforgettable character.
